Metadata.Title: Check Authorization for System Resource Access

Content.Data:
##Check Authorization for System Resource Access##
##Applies To##
- Ruby
##What to Do##
Check authorization before accessing system resources such as files, database connections, and network sockets.
##Why##
Access to system resources, such as files, must be considered by the developer. The application should check if the user is authorized to access system objects.
If the application exposes a system resource to the wrong control sphere, there is inappropriate access to the resource (CWE-668).
##When##
The application should always check if a file or other system resource should be available to the user.
##How##
Outline for "Check Authorization for Access to System Resources"
1. **Identify all operations performed by the application.** Make a spreadsheet that lists all operations implemented by the application. 2. **Identify system resources used by the application.** For each operation, determine what files, database connections, network sockets, or other system objects that are subject to access controls are being used. Add this information to the spreadsheet. 3. **Find code that accesses system resources.** Find all code that accesses system resources. Add information about this code to the spreadsheet. 4. **Check authorization before accessing system resources.** Add code that checks authorization to each function that accesses system resources before performing access to system resources. Use reference maps to restrict access to explicitly-authorized resources if possible.
##Additional Resources##
- [CWE-285: Improper Authorization)](https://cwe.mitre.org/ "CWE-285: Improper Authorization") - [CWE-668: Exposure of Resource to Wrong Sphere](https://cwe.mitre.org/ "CWE-668: Exposure of Resource to Wrong Sphere")
